Leaves: Greyish or bluish-green blades. Covered with a waxy bloom that can be rubbed off.
Flowers: Green, loose, sparse head of 4-8 pairs of spikelets in a 1.5-5 cm long V-shape, on stalks. Turns reddish-brown with age.
FruitSeeds: 2 mm long seeds contained within old flower parts. With long hairy awns.
DistinguishingFeatures: Has shorter awns than native Tambookie Grass (*Hyparrhenia filipendula*). Thatch grass (*Hyparrhenia rufa*) is generally taller.

Photos.Caption: Tall, erect but fine textured grass
Reddens at end of growing season
Usually about 1 m tall at maturity
